intro: Adopogon virginicus, commonly known as seaside oats, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the United States. It is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with slender, silver-gray blades that are adapted to withstand salt spray and sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in dense clusters, which are often seen in late summer and early fall. Seaside oats play an important role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion along coastal areas. Its ability to thrive in harsh maritime environments makes it a valuable component of coastal ecosystems.
